answers.answer: Hi,Have you ever got a MRI cervical spine done? The symptoms could be due to cervical spondylosis. The MRI will help in ruling it out

thank you for your response.  no, I haven't had one done.  maybe i should... i guess since I have symptoms in my face a spinal issue becomes less likely (?)  do you happen to know if ms would re-surface with the same symptoms?  I'm concerened about it, obviously, also since my head seems so foggy it's hard to concentrate.  I know ms is supposed to re-surface with separate locations but i wasn't sure if that meant separate locations inside the body or separate locations of symptoms.  if that makes any sense...

HI, I'm 40, female and also have had tingling mostly on my left side (with a bit on the right) for about a year. It's mostly in my feet, mostly my left foot, but I also have tingling in left center of my back sometimes, and occasionally on the left side of my chest, and  my left inner thigh and abdomen. I've never had it on my face or hands. I've had  brain and spine MRIs that were normal. (I had carpal tunnel in last year due to underactive thyorid and working on computer, but that's ok now).  My endocrinologist (thyroid MD) thought the tingling might be due to underactive thyroid, but my thyroid level is normal now (due to med) and MD no longer thinks this is from thyroid.  I've also suffered from migraines most of my adult life, and can't see any connection between the tingling sensations and migraines. MDs can't find a cause in my blood labs either. I work at a computer all day and don't know if that can be a cause, because I still have tingling on weekends when I rarely use the computer. Neuro MD told me normal brain and spine MRIs rule out MS, lesions, pinched nerve, disk problems. Have you had a EMG?  It tests your nerves and muscles for other nerve conditions.  Did you have your blood checked for diabetes, thyroid problems, etc? If you haven't has spine MRI you might have that don to see if you have pinched nerve or disk problem. I'm still seeking a diagnosis. Good luck!

question: thanks for reading my question.  I am a 36 yr old female.  4 1/2 yrs ago i had paresthesias in the face hands leg and feet -- mostly on the left side but on the right as well.  I would wake sometimes with a left hand that was numb and I'd have to shake it out.  Went to the neurologist who did exam and found nothing bad.  Symptoms went away in a couple weeks.  3 years later, last year, the same symptoms arose.  I went to neurologist who did testing including MRI which all thankfully was fine.  Symptoms resolved in a few weeks.  Last week, a year and a half later, symptoms are again.  Mostly left side but also on the right a bit.  This time with constant headach for past week and diziness.  I also have migraines with visual auras, this time just this headache.  I am obviously concerned about ms and wondered if anyone had thoughts. Thanks so much.
title: tingling question
